materials.raw_text: Cs: 10 g, O: 4 g, Pa: 5 g, Se: 20 g

sourcing.instructions: Cs (Cesium) can be obtained from chemical supply companies or online marketplaces; O (Oxygen) can be sourced from compressed gas suppliers; Pa (Protactinium) can be procured from specialized nuclear material suppliers; Se (Selenium) is available from chemical supply distributors.
steps: Cs (Cesium) can be obtained from chemical supply companies or online marketplaces; O (Oxygen) can be sourced from compressed gas suppliers; Pa (Protactinium) can be procured from specialized nuclear material suppliers; Se (Selenium) is available from chemical supply distributors.

1. Measure 10 g of Cs using a precise scale. 2. Measure 4 g of O and keep it sealed until ready for use. 3. Measure 5 g of Pa and ensure it is handled in a fume hood for safety. 4. Measure 20 g of Se carefully. 5. In a clean, dry container, combine all measured ingredients, ensuring even distribution. 6. Mix gently with a spatula until homogeneous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 10 g of Cs using a precise scale. 2. Measure 4 g of O and keep it sealed until ready for use. 3. Measure 5 g of Pa and ensure it is handled in a fume hood for safety. 4. Measure 20 g of Se carefully. 5. In a clean, dry container, combine all measured ingredients, ensuring even distribution. 6. Mix gently with a spatula until homogeneous.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a muffle furnace to 800째C for 2 hours. 3. Ensure to increase the temperature gradually to avoid any thermal shock.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a muffle furnace to 800째C for 2 hours. 3. Ensure to increase the temperature gradually to avoid any thermal shock.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled to at least 200째C to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled to at least 200째C to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the material from the crucible. 2. Grind the solid sample using a mortar and pestle for finer consistency. 3. If required, press the material into the desired dimensions using a hydraulic press. 4. Allow the pressed material to cure for 24 hours at room temperature. 5. Optionally, sand the edges for a smoother finish if necessary.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the material from the crucible. 2. Grind the solid sample using a mortar and pestle for finer consistency. 3. If required, press the material into the desired dimensions using a hydraulic press. 4. Allow the pressed material to cure for 24 hours at room temperature. 5. Optionally, sand the edges for a smoother finish if necessary.
